subject: Faulty Brake pedal sensor Order #SSN2051
description_text: I have received the Plus X Racing Simulator Pedal and Vam Pro, Order #SSN2051 .     The pedals work great unit I attached the VAM Pro motors. When either the throttle or brake VAM motor vibrates, the car stops in the game, even the brake pedal is not pressed. I removed the VAM motors, and the brake pedal worked fine. I then remove the brake pedal from the baseplate and turn it upside down. I put the VAM on top of the white sensor block, see attached Photo1.  When the VAM motor is activated, the sensor sends out a braking signal to the Simsonn Manager or Simhub app, see Photo2. I would think the brake sensor somehow short-circuited when it is being shaken. Could I return and exchange the brake pedal, or can you just send out a brake sensor (Photo3) for me to fix the problem, please? Many thanks

conversations.body_text: Hi Chi-Wing Liu,  The quickest replacement solution is to use nylon screws and nylon washers of the same specification (non-metal material) instead of the provided metal screws. The screw specification is M4×8mm, and the washer has an M4 inner diameter. This ensures proper electrical isolation between the bracket and the VAM Pro motor.
